column4: does anyone know of an ubuntu package or repo for VMWare server?
Best idea is to get vmware-server from vmware.com .
They update frequently, and even if dapper had support for it, it would be best to get it from the vendor.
is there any way to package it up into a deb?

I wish there was.  Maybe in a few months.  For now, I specify /usr/local/???? for all the questions except for the startup script dirs (/etc and /etc/rc.d) and the desktop icons (/usr/share/applications, etc.)
vmware server being free is a recent idea.
recent as in several months
it's not like it happened last week
Yeah I installed it just a couple of days ago.  Your best bet is to download the .tar.gz and install it with vmware-installl script.
link?
Just vmware.com.  Follow the VMWare Server links.  You need to register, but it's just to get a somewhat generic serial that the config script will understand.
do you know whether I'll have to reinstall Windows under VMWare or whether I'll be able to run my existing Windows partition?
live CD
there's a command to do it
With Windows, you'll need a fresh install under VMWare.  It's simply the way Windows works.
that's what I figured...
what's the advantage of using VMWare over something like Qemu then?
aside from performance of course
I dunno.  I prefer VMWare for the ease-of-use, but if you can get the same setup with qemu, with better performance, than go for it.
I believe VMWare has better performance
since it's at the kernel level
rather than the user level
For now :).  Wait for the hardware hypervisor support to take hold :)
